NOUNS (Otlar).example: He denied the serious **accusation** of fraud made against him.
Please contact us if you require any technical **assistance**.
Scientists achieved a major **breakthrough** in cancer research.
A **comparison** between the two phones shows many similarities.
They tried to avoid **conflict** by discussing the issue calmly.
There has been a sharp **decline** in the sales of print newspapers.
The oil spill was an environmental **disaster**.
You need written **permission** to film inside the museum.
Her immediate **reaction** to the news was a look of shock.
The company developed a new **strategy** to enter the Asian market.
Finishing the marathon was a great **achievement** for her.
Since the bus strike, we have been looking for travel **alternatives**.
He made an **attempt** to climb the mountain without a guide.
The teacher had the **authority** to assign extra homework.
Under the current **circumstances**, we cannot travel abroad.
Marriage requires a serious **commitment** from both partners.
We received a **complaint** about the noise from the neighbors.
Every member made a valuable **contribution** to the final report.
She faced a moral **dilemma** about telling the truth.
The **distribution** of food aid was managed by a local charity.

VERBS (Advanced).example: The manager should **acknowledge** the hard work of his team.
The council voted to **approve** the new budget plan.
The photographer managed to **capture** the moment perfectly.
The old bridge might **collapse** under the heavy rain.
Everyone should **contribute** to keeping the area clean.
The company plans to **decrease** its energy consumption.
We might **encounter** some delays due to the traffic.
The police were unable to **identify** the mysterious object.
I must **object** to the way you are handling this matter.
Can you **summarize** the main points of the chapter for me?

VERBS (B2-C1).example: Don't **assume** they are guilty until you have the facts.
The weather will **affect** our travel plans.
It is difficult to **maintain** a healthy diet while travelling.
This job will **require** strong computer skills.
She tried to **persuade** him to change his mind.
The company plans to **expand** its business to Europe.
The committee decided to **reject** the proposal immediately.
We need to **evaluate** the risks before starting the project.
The wind farms **generate** enough power for the entire city.
New laws will **regulate** the use of personal data online.

ADJECTIVES (Advanced).example: She is an **ambitious** student determined to succeed.
Daily exercise is **beneficial** to your health.
This is a very **complex** problem that requires careful thought.
They were **delighted** to hear the good news.
The museum housed an **enormous** collection of ancient artifacts.
The view from the top of the mountain was **incredible**.
They are looking for a **permanent** solution, not a temporary fix.
Wearing a warm coat in winter is a **sensible** idea.
He faced a **tough** decision about his career path.

ADJECTIVES (B2-C1).example: Please ensure your clothing is **appropriate** for the occasion.
She has been a **consistent** performer throughout the season.
The mistake was not accidental; it was a **deliberate** choice.
The new system is much more **efficient** than the old one.
The price of the ticket was quite **reasonable**.
We have **sufficient** time to finish the work.
His visa is only **temporary**; he must renew it soon.
There is a **widespread** belief that the economy will improve.
